basis: The user expresses strong intent to implement the 4-step routine today, requests reminders, and notes flexibility to shorten steps if overwhelmedâ€”indicating high likelihood of action aligned with the suggestion.
cognitive_dissonance: Aware of potential overwhelm vs. desire to maintain routine; balancing cravings and BED with need for calm, non-judgmental support; seeks reassurance through reminders to bridge intention and action.
negative_thought_patterns: Cravings can feel intense; concern about overwhelm or losing control; fear of not following through; tendency toward self-criticism when overwhelmed.
emotional_triggers: Stress and heat intensifying cravings; need for grounding and steady routine; environmental cues (shade/indoors) to reduce distress; desire for supportive reminders.
coaching_notes: Keep reinforcing the simple, actionable steps; offer optional interval reminders and check-ins; validate emotions and normalize adjustments when overwhelmed; highlight progress and celebrate small successes to sustain motivation.
